39127689.review:
Zawsze byłem za starymi grami, nigdy nie powiedziałem, że jeżeli gra jest brzydka
to nie można się przy niej dobrze bawić.
Mimo że ta gra ma parę wad to naprawde warto ją kupić,
gra jest też fajną inicjatywą dla osób które uwielbiają wątek II wojny światowej i nazistów
bowiem w grze wcielamy się w żołnierza, który stawia czoło armii nazistów (żołnieże, ss-mani, owczarki niem.) podróżując przez coraz to trudniejsze poziomy (piętra) aby zabić samego Adolfa Hitlera.
Gra jest troche trudna do ogarnięcia, ponieważ w oryginalnym wydaniu była na DoS-a
przez co oznaczenie przycisków ogranicza się tylko do myszki (B0 - LPM, B1 - RPM, B2 - M3) 
ale da się to wymasterować i nawet gra się całkiem przyjemnie :).
Polecam wszystkim co lubią starsze gry.
8/10

40889256.review:
Wolfenstein 3D is the grandfather and original classic of the FPS genre.  However I would say that it has aged very poorly, while Doom can arguably be enjoyed by any generation of gamers I can't say the same for Wolf3D.  I would still recommend it for its simple yet basic fundamental FPS gameplay, and it is still fun if you can get used to the way it was originally designed.

This is as basic as you can get from an FPS.  You run, aim, shoot Nazis, and find keys to open doors to get to the exit.  What it is missing that you appreciate in games today (for me) is: default strafing and an automap.  What I mean is strafing is used as a toggle only, so you can only either look side to side or strafe.  At least in Doom you could set the left/right keys as strafe and use the mouse to look.

The graphics are so rudimentary, understandably since its one of the first 3D games in 1992, that a lot of the rooms look similar and its grid and maze structure means you can get lost easily.  If it had a map system it would help tremendously where you otherwise feel like a rat in a maze wall humping everywhere.

The shooting gameplay is still as fun as it was back then.  Mouse controls feels right, and the gun/enemy balance is great, so that you can waste Nazis quickly depending on your weapon, and at the same time get taken out just as quick if you are ganged up or they sneak up on you.

40757040.review: I'd say this game hasn't aged well, but don't let that discourage you, you can still get your enjoyment here by shooting nazis. The controls are a bit clunky and the game turns into a maze at times, but you can still see how this genre became so popular in the end, even if Doom was the game that really made the genre.

40572629.review: This game has not aged as well as Doom or Quake, but it's a good game to see where your modern FPS came from.  However as I said in my Doom review, DOSbox sucks.  You should download ECWolf, and move all of your wolfenstein files that you downloaded from Steam into your ECWolf folder (This also works for Spear of Destiny).  Unlike Doom where there are multiple source ports I can recommend like Chocolate Doom, GZDoom, Zandronum, etc, I can only recommend ECWolf for Wolfenstein.  It says this on the website, but Super 3D Noah's Ark on Steam uses more or less the same code as ECWolf.  I just want to make these reviews to spread the word about superior ways to play these games, although you will still need to purchase these games on Steam as these source ports cannot legally contain any files of these original games (similar to how emulation is illegal).  My overall verdict on this game is that I think Doom aged far better, but Wolfenstein is still a good time.

40390569.review:
Хотел написать положительный обзор... Оо поиграв в эту игру дольше, понял, что должен поступить иначе. 

На современную ОС игра идёт с трудом, а управление просто мозговыносящее! Долго мучился, но потом поставил ECWolf. Это решило проблему. И текстурки стали выглядеть лучше, и производительность улучшилась, игра стала более плавной. Появилась возможность нормально настроить управление. Игра стала лучше, но всё равно моё мнение не изменилось.

По началу игра показалась уж слишком казуальной, но затем втянулся и первую половину игры прошёл на одном дыхании. Но во второй половине игры появилась ещё одна особенность. Если раньше тыкаться в каждый угол, в надежде найти секрет, было необязательно, то теперь это сделали частью обязательного прохождения, так как ключ, необходимый для открытия двери, был спрятан где-то в стенах. Уровни стали ещё запутанней, а враги многочисленней. А ведь враги и так как буд-то знают заранее откуда ты выйдешь и начинают стрелять раньше, чем ты успеешь отреагировать, а бьют они очень больно. Дальше игра стала приедаться: одинаковые текстуры, одинаковые враги, одно и то же оружие. Игровой процесс изменялся только в худшую сторону. 

Меня могут закидать помидорами: "Ты просто ньюфаг и ничего не понимаешь в старых играх, это же годнота! Игра моего детства!" Я скажу на это, что это неплохая игра, но она всё же сильно устарела. Даже игры, которые вышли немного позже играются гораздо веселее. 

Советую для ознакомления, не более.

40371501.review: ONLY use this game for a sourceport or mod

40265905.review:
This is it. The game that started it all. Sure, there had been FPS games before Wolfenstein 3D, but it was thanks to this game that the genre gained popularity. Simple, fast-paced gameplay is what gave Wolf 3D it's place as the "grandfather of first-person shooters". While I'll admit it hasn't aged well, especially on the graphics department (which should be obvious, considering it was first released in 1992), I think it should still be played by those who love the genre.

Like I said, the gameplay is simple: you start with a gun and a knife, and you have to explore the level in order to find the exit to the next one, killing Nazis on the way. Other than a health and ammo display (plus score, lives and equipped weapon), the HUD isn't all that fancy (although seeing Blazkowicz face get progressively worse as you get damage is a cool detail). The weapon selection consists of only four weapons, and even then, the game doesn't need much more. The action is fast-paced, the levels packed with enemies. It's a really fun experience.

The story is simple: you're Blazkowicz, and you fight Nazis. After completing each episode, you get a small screen giving a few more story details, but all you need to know is just the part about fighting Nazis. And honestly, the game doesn't need a lot more. Even though in modern times games usually have more extensive stories (which is a great thing, mind you), this one simply gives you a basic frame, and lets you go from there.

Well, that's all for Wolfenstein 3D. I recommend it, if anything, because it's a piece of gaming history.

40038331.review:
Before Quake, Before Heretic, Before Shadow Warrior, Before Duke Nukem 3D, Before Doom there is a first-person shooter call Wolfenstein 3D! 

For an adult gamer like me these are all amazing first-person shooters that introduced the world to FPS. Wolfenstein 3D being the first that started it all. Simple maze wandering level based first person shooter about killing Nazis. Being the first it’s repetitive and so basic compare to all the other FPS. 9 basic levels + 1 secret level for each episode. 6 episodes in total for 2 series. (main game + prequal) 

You can feel the age of this game if you play it now as the graphics and music are all quite old. Graphics can be improved quite a bit by downloading MOD such as ECWolf. There are also thousands of fan-made levels available to download on the internet for this grandfather of First person shooter.

You may not know this, but Id Soft was a indie studio back then with only 6 employees! Even though their company focus shifted to DOOM and never made another Wolfenstein 3D game after spear of Destiny many other company picked it and made many games to follow this series:

•	Wolfenstein 3D (1992)
•	Spear of Destiny (1992)
•	Return to Castle Wolfenstein (2001)
•	Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory (2003)
•	Wolfenstein RPG (2008)
•	Wolfenstein (2009)
•	Wolfenstein: The New Order (2014)
•	Wolfenstein: The Old Blood (2015)
•	Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus (2017)

10/10 and this game needs to be worshiped by today’s gamer. If you never played it give it try! It’s old but it’s still gold!

40010814.review:
Los 90s significó el despegue absoluto de los FPS. Y Wolfestein 3D se coronó Rey indiscutible derrocando a Catacomb 3D. Salvando las distancias gráficas, es prácticamente igual que los juegos actuales 15 años más adelantados. La visión fija del arma que usamos y el HUD que te proporciona la información del juego sobre tu personaje: La Salud, La munición, La Armas, Las Llaves etc...
Y no nos confundamos, aquí vamos a lo que vamos. Matar Nazis, punto. Explora niveles laberinticos a lo largo de 6 episodios, a modo de misiones continuistas, exterminando Nazis para acabar al final en el bunker del Tio Adolf, y mandarle al otro barrio. 

Es un juego difícil, Rápido y Agresivo, que demanda paciencia y comprensión a las mecánicas. Una experiencia llena de carácter.

39689616.review:
Good game, shit port.

This version of Wolf 3D is nothing but the original DOS version on a vanilla version of DOSBox. 

Quite frankly you're better off downloading and emulating the Mac, Jaguar or modded version of the original game with improved movement and textures than this.

I bought this game out of pure nostalgia and quite frankly I'm not happy with my purchase a couple of years later.
